intro: Wendtia reynoldsii, commonly known as the Reynolds' wendtia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, lantern-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and broad, oval leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Wendtia reynoldsii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
